paragraphs.content: Chapter 3
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 3

paragraphs.content: Woe to her that is filthy and polluted, to the oppressing city!
paragraphs.contentHtml: Woe to her that is filthy and polluted, to the oppressing city!

paragraphs.content: She obeyed not the voice; she received not correction; she trusted not in the LORD; she drew not near to her God.
paragraphs.contentHtml: She obeyed not the voice; she received not correction; she trusted not in the Lord; she drew not near to her God.

paragraphs.content: Her princes within her are roaring lions; her judges are evening wolves; they gnaw not the bones till the morrow.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Her princes within her are roaring lions; her judges are evening wolves; they gnaw not the bones till the morrow.

paragraphs.content: Her prophets are light and treacherous persons: her priests have polluted the sanctuary, they have done violence to the law.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Her prophets are light and treacherous persons: her priests have polluted the sanctuary, they have done violence to the law.

paragraphs.content: The just LORD is in the midst thereof; he will not do iniquity: every morning doth he bring his judgment to light, he faileth not; but the unjust knoweth no shame.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The just Lord is in the midst thereof; he will not do iniquity: every morning doth he bring his judgment to light, he faileth not; but the unjust knoweth no shame.

paragraphs.content: I have cut off the nations: their towers are desolate; I made their streets waste, that none passeth by: their cities are destroyed, so that there is no man, that there is none inhabitant.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I have cut off the nations: their towers are desolate; I made their streets waste, that none passeth by: their cities are destroyed, so that there is no man, that there is none inhabitant.

paragraphs.content: I said, Surely thou wilt fear me, thou wilt receive instruction; so their dwelling should not be cut off, howsoever I punished them: but they rose early, and corrupted all their doings.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I said, Surely thou wilt fear me, thou wilt receive instruction; so their dwelling should not be cut off, howsoever I punished them: but they rose early, and corrupted all their doings.

paragraphs.content: ¶ Therefore wait ye upon me, saith the LORD, until the day that I rise up to the prey: for my determination is to gather the nations, that I may assemble the kingdoms, to pour upon them mine indignation, even all my fierce anger: for all the earth shall be devoured with the fire of my jealousy.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ Therefore wait ye upon me, saith the Lord, until the day that I rise up to the prey: for my determination is to gather the nations, that I may assemble the kingdoms, to pour upon them mine indignation, even all my fierce anger: for all the earth shall be devoured with the fire of my jealousy.

paragraphs.content: For then will I turn to the people a pure language, that they may all call upon the name of the LORD, to serve him with one consent.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For then will I turn to the people a pure language, that they may all call upon the name of the Lord, to serve him with one consent.

paragraphs.content: From beyond the rivers of Ethiopia my suppliants, even the daughter of my dispersed, shall bring mine offering.
paragraphs.contentHtml: From beyond the rivers of Ethiopia my suppliants, even the daughter of my dispersed, shall bring mine offering.

paragraphs.content: In that day shalt thou not be ashamed for all thy doings, wherein thou hast transgressed against me: for then I will take away out of the midst of thee them that rejoice in thy pride, and thou shalt no more be haughty because of my holy mountain.
paragraphs.contentHtml: In that day shalt thou not be ashamed for all thy doings, wherein thou hast transgressed against me: for then I will take away out of the midst of thee them that rejoice in thy pride, and thou shalt no more be haughty because of my holy mountain.

paragraphs.content: I will also leave in the midst of thee an afflicted and poor people, and they shall trust in the name of the LORD.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I will also leave in the midst of thee an afflicted and poor people, and they shall trust in the name of the Lord.

paragraphs.content: The remnant of Israel shall not do iniquity, nor speak lies; neither shall a deceitful tongue be found in their mouth: for they shall feed and lie down, and none shall make them afraid.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The remnant of Israel shall not do iniquity, nor speak lies; neither shall a deceitful tongue be found in their mouth: for they shall feed and lie down, and none shall make them afraid.

paragraphs.content: ¶ Sing, O daughter of Zion; shout, O Israel; be glad and rejoice with all the heart, O daughter of Jerusalem.
paragraphs.contentHtml: ¶ Sing, O daughter of Zion; shout, O Israel; be glad and rejoice with all the heart, O daughter of Jerusalem.

paragraphs.content: The LORD hath taken away thy judgments, he hath cast out thine enemy: the king of Israel, even the LORD, is in the midst of thee: thou shalt not see evil any more.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The Lord hath taken away thy judgments, he hath cast out thine enemy: the king of Israel, even the Lord, is in the midst of thee: thou shalt not see evil any more.

paragraphs.content: In that day it shall be said to Jerusalem, Fear thou not: and to Zion, Let not thine hands be slack.
paragraphs.contentHtml: In that day it shall be said to Jerusalem, Fear thou not: and to Zion, Let not thine hands be slack.

paragraphs.content: The LORD thy God in the midst of thee is mighty; he will save, he will rejoice over thee with joy; he will rest in his love, he will joy over thee with singing.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The Lord thy God in the midst of thee is mighty; he will save, he will rejoice over thee with joy; he will rest in his love, he will joy over thee with singing.

paragraphs.content: I will gather them that are sorrowful for the solemn assembly, who are of thee, to whom the reproach of it was a burden.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I will gather them that are sorrowful for the solemn assembly, who are of thee, to whom the reproach of it was a burden.

paragraphs.content: Behold, at that time I will undo all that afflict thee: and I will save her that halteth, and gather her that was driven out; and I will get them praise and fame in every land where they have been put to shame.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Behold, at that time I will undo all that afflict thee: and I will save her that halteth, and gather her that was driven out; and I will get them praise and fame in every land where they have been put to shame.

paragraphs.content: At that time will I bring you again, even in the time that I gather you: for I will make you a name and a praise among all people of the earth, when I turn back your captivity before your eyes, saith the LORD.
paragraphs.contentHtml: At that time will I bring you again, even in the time that I gather you: for I will make you a name and a praise among all people of the earth, when I turn back your captivity before your eyes, saith the Lord.
